CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 9, 1961, pg. 2, reads: "Rescue Home - Located at 207 Robinson St., this rambling structure is scheduled to be one of the 'Triumph Rescue Homes for the Needy' as operated by Bishop Harris and the Triumph Church. The property formerly was managed by DePaul Smith. - Harris Photos."  Portion of accompanying article reads: "Smith Filled Need Ignored by Public?  Editor's note: While Pittsburgh (The Renaissance City) proudly displays its renovation of the Golden Triangle, highlights by the $22 million Civic Arena, to its many citizens and visitors, and maps magnificent plans for 'urban renewal, it has 'swept under the rug its 'dregs of human misery' - those displaced persons, a majority of whom are Negroes, who either have not been relocated or are unable to find suitable housing on their own.  Crack Courier reporter Phyl Garland has gone behind the scenes to interview and write about these 'Prisoners of the Ghetto' and their vicious 'jailer.'  This is the third in a series of articles which The Courier offers its readers..."
TitMainTitle: Two story brick house with porch, decorative brackets and borders, and peaked roof, 207 Robinson Street, Oakland
